data.text:
Jan 13th 2011

1. Introduction

1.1. About the FAQ

The intent of this FAQ is to provide information on the Italian band â€˜LACUNA COILâ€™. The latest version of the FAQ is maintained at Emptyspiral.net.

All comments and suggestions or revisions can be sent to [email protected] or posted on the forums at www.emptyspiral.net.

1.3. Author and Acknowledgements

The LACUNA COIL FAQ was originally compiled and written by Matt Wrycraft ([email protected]) and Gabriel Knight ([email protected]), with contributions by fans on Emptyspiral.net forums and the Senzafine Yahoogroup. Thank you everyone who took the time to help out with this. You know who you are.

1.4. Legal Stuff

This FAQ is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. While every effort has been taken to ensure the accuracy of the information contained in this article, the authors assume no responsibility for errors or omissions, or for damages resulting from the use of the information contained herein. The contents of this FAQ reflect opinions and the results of research by the authors and contributors are not necessarily those of LACUNA COIL or their management.

[hozbreaktop]

2. LACUNA COIL Online

2.1. Does LACUNA COIL have an Official web site?

Yes! You can find the official LACUNA COIL website at www.lacunacoil.it

2.2. Is there an official Mailing List?

The official mailing list is the â€˜Senzafineâ€™ Yahoo group. It should be noted that you will not see any official announcements on the group, it is for general discussion by LACUNA COIL fans. More information can be found at the Yahoo group website at http://launch.groups.yahoo.com/group/Senzafine/. You can subscribe to list by sending an email to [email protected].

2.3. Is there an official Fanclub/Site?

Yes, www.emptyspiral.net is the Worldwide Fanclub, and is supported by the band and their record label Century Media. There is also an official Italian fansite â€“ www.lacunacoilitalia.com

2.4. Does LACUNA COIL, or any of the band members, have social networking pages?

There are official LACUNA COIL pages at www.myspace.com/lacunacoil and www.facebook.com/lacunacoil. A few of the band members have personal pages:

Cristina Scabbia â€“ www.myspace.com/cristinascabbia and www.facebook.com/pages/Cristina-Scabbia-Official

Andrea Ferro â€“ www.myspace.com/andreaferro and www.facebook.com/pages/Andrea-Ferro-Official-Public-Page

Marco â€˜Mausâ€™ Biazzi â€“ www.myspace.com/marcobiazzi and www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100000383254926

2.5. Is there an official Forum?

The forum at emptyspiral.net is recognised as the official forum as part of the LACUNA COIL Community.

2.6. Is there a LACUNA COIL Usenet newsgroup?

There is no specific newsgroup for LACUNA COIL discussion. You could try looking at it.arti.musica.metal or alt.gothic.music for LACUNA COIL information or discussions.

2.7. Is there an IRC Channel?

For Italian chat you can use #lacunachat on the Azzurra IRC Network. There is also a #lacunacoil channel on DALNet.

2.8. Where can I buy LACUNA COIL merchandise?

The albums and self-titled EP can be found or ordered at most large music stores, and at most online stores. The official merchandise sites are:

http://lacunacoil.shop.bravadousa.com US

https://www.backstreet-merch.com/stores/lacunacoil/ EU

You can also try the following sites:

http://www.negative.it/ (Italian)

http://www.grindstore.com/

Additionally there is a regularly updated thread in the emptyspiral.net forums which contains merchandise-related information.

2.9. Is there a LACUNA COIL Twitter Feed, or do another of the band members use Twitter?

Yes, the official LACUNA COIL Twitter is @lacuna_coil

Cristina uses Twitter â€“ @MissScabbia

CriZ uses Twitter â€“ @LC_CriZ

2.10. What about other web resources?

There are numerous LACUNA COIL websites across the World Wide Web, including a number of links on the official site (www.lacunacoil.it)

Though by no means exhaustive here are a few places to get you started:

â€˜Emptyspiral.netâ€™ â€“ The Official fanclub â€“ https://emptyspiral.net

[hozbreaktop]

3. The Band and History

3.1. What does â€˜LACUNA COILâ€™ mean?

The closest English translation is â€˜Empty Spiralâ€™, it was chosen when the band changed their name from Ethereal and it is meant to express the bands vision on life. In the words of Cristina Scabbia; â€œItâ€™s half Italian, half English â€“ Lacunaâ€™s an Italian word from the Latin meaning lack of memory or emptiness. â€˜Coilâ€™ is a spiral.â€

3.2. What does that â€˜oriental symbolâ€™ represent?

It is in fact a stylised â€˜Lâ€™ and â€˜Câ€™ with the C crossing the L halfway down the vertical. LACUNA COIL have changed logos a couple of times now. A second version of the logo was turned about 30 degrees, the â€˜Câ€™ was changed, and it was enclosed in a circle. A third version of the logo is now used, it is a return to the more â€˜orientalâ€™ look but is more symmetrical. You can see all three versions at https://emptyspiral.net/images/lacuna_coil_logos.gif

3.3 What style of music do LACUNA COIL play?

Itâ€™s not easy to define LACUNA COILs musical style, and is certainly a topic for discussion. However, in Cristinaâ€™s own words LACUNA COIL plays â€œa mixture between gothic, rock and metal with a modern touchâ€. Thatâ€™s as close as youâ€™ll get to an official answer.

3.4. Who are the members of LACUNA COIL?

The current line up of LACUNA COIL is:

â€“ Cristina Scabbia: Female vocals

â€“ Andrea Ferro: Male vocals

â€“ Cristiano Migliore: Guitars

â€“ Marco â€˜Mausâ€™ Biazzi: Guitars

â€“ Marco Coti Zelati: Bass guitar

â€“ Cristiano â€˜CriZâ€™ Mozzati: Drums & percussion

The original line up was:

â€“ Cristina Scabbia: Female vocals

â€“ Andrea Ferro: Male vocals

â€“ Raffaele Zagaria: Guitars

â€“ Claudio Leo: Guitars

â€“ Marco Coti Zelati: Bass guitar

â€“ Leonardo Forti: Drums & percussion

3.5. When/how was the band formed?

The following is taken from the LACUNA COIL Biography at www.emptyspiral.net:

The genesis of Lacuna Coil can be traced back to Milan, 1994 when guitarist and songwriter Marco Coti-Zelati and his friend, Andrea Ferro, form the band Sleep of Right. Marco plays guitar, Andrea plays bass, and Raffaele Zagaria joins them on guitar and Michelangelo on the drums. The band plays their first live gig in Bologna, Italy in 1994. They record Bleeding Souls which sees release in 1995 on the Noise of Bolgia compilation CD.

Marco soon moves to playing bass so that Andrea can concentrate on vocals and they are joined by Claudio Leo, as second guitarist, and Leonardo Forti on drums; following the departure of Michelangelo. Their next decision no doubt changes the direction their future music would take forever; they ask a female friend, Cristina Scabbia, to sing some backing tracks for them. It is clear that Cristinaâ€™s soaring, natural vocals, perfectly compliment the deep growling of Andrea Ferro and they ask her to join the band permanently. After the inclusion of Cristina Scabbia as female vocals the band changes their name to Ethereal and in May 1996 a two-track demo tape, with the songs Shallow End and Frozen Feeling, is recorded and sent to several European record labels. The band receives responses from Nuclear Blast and Century Media and decides to sign the deal with Century Media. Now, with the record deal in place the band discover that the name Ethereal has already been taken by a Greek band. The bands now firmly established line-up â€“ Cristina Scabbia, Andrea Ferro, Marco Coti-Zelati, Claudio Leo, Raffaele Zagaria, and Leonardo Forti â€“ settle on the name LACUNA COIL, meaning â€œEmpty Spiralâ€, reflecting their vision on life.

3.6. What happened to the original band members?

There were musical differences in the studio during the recording of the Lacuna Coil EP in 1997, and ultimately the band broke up during their 1997 tour supporting Moonspell with Raffaele, Claudio, and Leonardo leaving. In December of that year Cristiano Migliore and Cristiano Mozzati were asked to join to replace them, and Marco â€˜Mausâ€™ Biazzi joined later in October 1998. The line up-has remained constant since that time.

Claudio Leo and Raffaele Zagaria went onto form the band â€˜Cayneâ€™ and have released an album â€˜Old Faded Picturesâ€™

Claudio Leo is currently the guitarist in a band called â€˜No Namesâ€™

3.7 Have any other people played with LACUNA COIL? â€“ Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ve seen another woman playing keyboardsâ€¦

Yes. The woman you refer to is Alice Chiarelli who played keyboards in1998 during their European tour supporting The Gathering. Also Steve Minelli (ex-Node, ex-Death SS) also played guitar in March and April 1998 during their European tour.

3.8. How do I meet the band?

You are most likely to meet them after a live show. LACUNA COIL take the time meet fans and sign autographs, and are very approachable. Take the time to support them!

3.9. Can I email the band?

Yes, though the band is always busy and are unlikely to respond straight away. Their email addresses are:

â€“ Cristina Scabbia: [email protected]

â€“ Andrea Ferro: [email protected]

â€“ Cristiano Migliore: [email protected]

â€“ Marco Biazzi: [email protected]

â€“ Marco Coti Zelati: [email protected]

â€“ Cristiano Mozzati: [email protected]

3.10. What kind of equipment do LACUNA COIL use/endorse?

A complex question. Like any band LACUNA COIL have used a variety of instruments and musical equipment over the years.

Here is a list of known equipment currently believed to be used/endorsed:

Drums:

Pearl Master Custom kit

8/10/12/14/16 inch toms

13Ã—5 in snare

20 in kick

Remo drum heads

UFIP cymbals

Natural and Rough series (various sizes)

Opus 51 (kickdrum); m 201 (snaredrum top); opus 88 (snaredrum bottom and smaller toms); opus 87 (floor toms);

mce 930 (hi hat and cymbals); opus 99 (bass cabinet)

Guitars:

ESP/LTD Stephen Carpenter 7-strings with standard EMG pickups

Ibanez sgr 5 strings basses

Dean Markley strings 52-9 (Maus) 60-10 (Pizza)

Bass & guitars wireless systems: Beyerdynamic opus 500 with ts 500 transmitters.

Amps/Cabs:

Line 6 spider valve mk2 HD 100

Gallien Krueger rb 2001 heads

Gallien Krueger neo 412 cabinets

Mics:

Lead vocals: Beyerdynamic opus 900 wireless systems with sem 881 hand held mike.

Andrea uses beyerdynamic in ear systems: ims 800

Effects:

Alesis adat hd 24 (not endorsed)

3.11. Why do LACUNA COIL sing in English instead of Italian?

Simply put, Italian does not lend itself well to the type of songs that they want to sing. It works well for melodic songs, but not for heavier fast sounds. LACUNA COIL have a couple of songs with Italian lyrics â€˜Senzafineâ€™ â€“ off of the Halflife EP and Unleashed Memories album, and â€˜Comaliesâ€™ off of the Comalies album.

[hozbreaktop]

4. Release History

4.1. What Albums/EPs/Singles/DVDs have LACUNA COIL released?

They released two EPs and five full albums as LACUNA COIL, as well as a number of singles:

â€“ Lacuna Coil (EP) â€“ Released 1997

â€“ In a Reverie (Album) â€“ Released 1999

â€“ HalfLife (EP) â€“ Released 2000

â€“ Unleashed Memories(Album) â€“ Released 2001

â€“ Comalies (Album) â€“ Released 2002

â€“ Heavenâ€™s a Lie (single) â€“ Released 2002

â€“ Swamped (Single) â€“ Released 7th June 2004

â€“ 2CD edition of Comalies (with acoustic songs on second CD)

â€“ â€“ Released in the US on 1st June 2004 as â€˜Ozzfest Editionâ€™

â€“ â€“ Released in Europe on 2st June 2004 as â€˜Limited Edition Deluxe Editionâ€™

â€“ In a Reverie (Album) â€“ Re-released 2005 (new cover and content)

â€“ Unleashed Memories(Album) â€“ Re-released 2005 (new cover and content)

â€“ The EPs (combines songs from Lacuna Coil EP and Halflife EP) â€“ Released 2005

â€“ Our Truth (Single) â€“ Released March 6th 2006 (Europe) and March 20th 2006 (UK)

â€“ Karmacode (Album) â€“ Released March 31st (Europe), April 3rd 2006 (UK) and April 4th 2006 (US)

â€“ Enjoy The Silence (Single) â€“ Released June 26th 2006 (UK)

â€“ Closer (Single) â€“ Released October 16th 2006 (UK)

â€“ Within Me (Single) â€“ Released May 4th 2007 (Italy)

â€“ Visual Karma â€“ Body Mind & Soul (DVD) â€“ Released 2008

â€“ Manifesto Ofâ€¦Lacuna Coil CD (â€˜Best ofâ€™ Compilation Album)- Released 2008

â€“ Spellbound (Single) â€“ Released 2009

â€“ Shallow Life (Album) â€“ Released 2009

â€“ Trip The Darknes (Digital Single) â€“ Released 2011

As Ethereal they produced a two-track demo. It has never been officially released, though one of the tracks Shallow-End is available for download.

4.2. What videos have they released?

LACUNA COIL have released three official videos for their single â€˜Heavenâ€™s a Lieâ€™. The first is a studio â€˜making-ofâ€™ video put to music. Itâ€™s an edit of the video released on the Comalies album. The second was filmed in Los Angeles, directed by Chade Seide, and released in May 2003. It is recognisable with Andrea and Cristina sitting on stairs, and Cristina singing through banisters. The third version was directed by Patric Ullaeus and released in December 2003. In it the band are playing in a large gothic hall and Cristina is wearing a white dress. Other special FX shots are also shown. This is the version seen on MTV and to most people is considered the â€˜Officialâ€™ Heavens A Lie video.

Working again with Patric Ullaeus, the Director of the â€˜Official Heavens a Lieâ€™ video, LACUNA COIL have also released a video for their â€˜Swampedâ€™, also taken from the Comalies album. The video is set in a gothic mansion, as well as a firey desert.

LACUNA COIL worked with director duo Fort Awesome for the video to â€˜Our Truthâ€™ the first video released from their 2006 album karmacode. Shot in Los Angeles, this video can be recognised as being set inside a snow globe in a forest.

The band worked with Fort Awesome again for the video to their cover of Depeche Modeâ€™s â€˜Enjoy The Silenceâ€™. This can be recognised as cutâ€™s between city scenes and the band playing in a dark room. The video was changed for release in the UK and live shots from the bands performance at the Forum on March 6th in London are included in this version.

LACUNA COIL continued their relationship with Fort Awesome with the release of the video for â€˜Closerâ€™. Again shot in Los Angeles this video starts with Cristina driving a car, and ends with her meeting the rest of the band who have dug a hole to reveal a case containing what some believe is the Hebraic â€˜Tree of Lifeâ€™

In 2007 LACUNA COIL released a video for the Within Me single. The video was filmed by Karl Karman from March 2nd till March 3th, 2007 in Turin Borgo Medievaleâ€™s park and castle and in desert in Sardinia.

In 2009 LACUNA COIL released a video for the single Spellbound. The video was filmed by Italian director Roberto Cinardi AKA Saku, in Milan at Dolce & Gabbanaâ€™s Gold on February 2009. There are in fact 2 versions of the video, the second showing various seens of people under the â€˜spellâ€™ of obsession etc.

Later in the same year LACUNA COIL released a video for their song I Like It. The video was filmed in Kansas City, USA, by the American director Kevin Custer in May 2009.

In early 2010 LACUNA COIL released the video for their song I Wonâ€™t Tell You. The video was directed again by Saku and is notable in that LACUNA COIL fans are included in the video.

In late 2011 LACUNA COIL released the video for the song Trip The Darkness â€“ the first track of the 2012 album Dark Adrenaline. The video was directed by Sitcom Soldiers.

4.3. Are the videos available anywhere?

You can find the videos on at the official site (www.lacunacoil.it) as well as the LACUNA COIL Youtube (www.youtube.com/user/lacunacoil) and myspace pages (www.myspace.com/lacunacoil)

4.4. Where can I buy the CDs?

Everywhere! Well, most music stores carry â€˜Comaliesâ€™ and â€˜Karmacodeâ€™. Online music stores (amazon.com being the most popular one) will have the older albums as well. You can also buy from directly Century Media online store â€“ www.centurymediashop.com.

â€˜HalfLifeâ€™ EP is put of print, but is included as a bonus on the Unleashed Memories (see section 9). The songs have also been included on â€˜The EPsâ€™ re-release. Expect to have a hard time finding the original versionâ€¦

The â€˜Heavenâ€™s a Lieâ€™ CD single had a very limited release and is all but impossible to find.

The singles â€˜Swampedâ€™, â€˜Our Truthâ€™, â€˜Enjoy The Silenceâ€™, and â€˜Closerâ€™ can be found at online stores like http://www.emp-online.com. Note that the singles were never released in the US.

The â€˜Within Meâ€™ single is very hard to find as it was only released in Italy. Try Amazon or Ebay.

Shallow Life should be easy to find.

4.5. What songs are never played live?

As far as we know the following songs have never been played live:

Shallow Life:

â€“ I Like It

â€“ The Pain

Karmacode:

â€“ (All songs have been played)

Comalies:

â€“ The Ghost Woman and the Hunter

â€“ The Prophet Said

â€“ Comalies

Unleashed Memories:

â€“ Distant Sun

Halflife:

â€“ Stars

In a Reverie:

â€“ To Myself I Turned

Lacuna Coil:

â€“ (All have been played live â€“ even Un Fantasma Tra Noi!)

5. Ethereal Demo

5.1. What songs are included on the demo?

â€˜Shallow Endâ€™ and â€˜Frozen Feelingâ€™.

5.2. Where can I find the demo?

The demo was released on tape and was never re-released officially. It has been seen on ebay from time to time, but the validity of the sale item is unknown

5.3. Have any of the tracks been released?

Shallow End was available as an MP3 download on the official site for a while, but has since been removed. You can now download the track at www.emptyspiral.net/modules.php?name=Downloads&d_op=getit&lid=142

5.4. Why isnâ€™t â€˜Frozen Feelingâ€™ available anywhere?

The band doesnâ€™t want it distributed. We are not entirely sure why, but a couple of people who got a copy of the cassette tape from the band were asked not to distribute it. However, Andrea mentioned in an Emptyspiral.net interview that some day they may make it available for download, so you never knowâ€¦

[hozbreaktop]

6. LACUNA COIL EP

6.1. What does â€˜Un Fanstasma Tra Noiâ€™ mean?

â€œA ghost between usâ€

6.2. Why donâ€™t I recognise all the band members in the CD sleeve?

You are looking at the original band line-up, see section 3.3

[hozbreaktop]

7. In a Reverie

7.1. Doesnâ€™t Falling again sound the same as Falling from the LACUNA COIL EP?

Not really. Listen to the 2 songs back to back and youâ€™ll hear distinct differences. First of all, the lyrics are slightly different. Also Cristinaâ€™s voice is clearer and â€œup frontâ€ in the mix on Falling then on Falling Again. Additionally Falling Again features the entire band playing, not just guitar and keyboards. The lyrics are nearly identical, so you can consider Falling Again (on the â€˜In A Reverieâ€™ album), a re-arrangement of Falling (from the â€˜Lacuna Coilâ€™ EP).

7.2 Why was Falling re-recorded?

The song was written by Marco, but the old members of LC insisted on recording the song the way it is on the self-titled EP, without distorted guitars and drums. So they re-recorded it the way they originally wanted it to be (as explained by Cristina in the interview with Kaleidoscope magazine, Issue 6 â€“ Autumn 1999)

7.3 What inspired the cover of In A Reverie?

Note: This refers to the original release of the In A Reverie album

Cristina explains in the interview with Kaleidoscope magazine, Issue 6 â€“ Autumn 1999:

â€œIt was a co-operation between us and a German artist, and we chose to do some body painting, and to use ourselves instead of models or something like that. We wanted to be like two strange creatures in a wood, in a fantastic world. And to be in a reverie â€“ like the title of the album. And we wanted it to be about nature, because when you are in a wood, for example, you are free, because you can scream, you can do everything â€“ there is nobody there to look at you. And thatâ€™s why we chose a wood sceneography; to be like, you know, elf creatures â€“ but only because we wanted to do something special â€“ not for a real meaning. We wanted a special cover to attract attentionâ€.

7.4 How many In A Reverie covers are there?

There are two very different covers to the In A Reverie album.

The 1999 original release has a black cover with Andrea and Cristina sitting â€˜nakedâ€™ and painted in a forest.

The 2005 re-released has a artistic blue/white cover with a white in a foreground by a shore. In the back is a dark archway set in a white wall. The cover was created by Raj Naik of http://www.rajnaik.com

[hozbreaktop]

8. Halflife EP

8.1. Isnâ€™t Stars a cover song?

Yes, itâ€™s a cover of a song by British pop band â€œDubstarâ€. You can find out more information, as well as listen to the original recording at www.stevehillier.net/dubstar.html

There is also a video on the Internet. It not an official video.

8.2. Who designed the cover?

Well, actually the cover for the EP was designed by LACUNA COILâ€™s bassist â€“ Marco Coti Zelati.

[hozbreaktop]

9. Unleashed Memories

9.1. I donâ€™t understand Senzafine! Are the English lyrics available anywhere?

Yes, on the official site (www.lacunacoil.it) and in the discography at www.emptyspiral.net

9.2. What does Senzafine mean?

Itâ€™s a combination of 2 Italian words, â€œsenzaâ€ (without) and â€œfineâ€ (end), so it means something like â€œNeverendingâ€ or â€œEndlessâ€.

9.3. Senzafine was also on the Halflife EP, why was it released twice? And what are the differences?

The Unleashed Memories version is slightly different. The lyrics are a little different, and also The Unleashed Memories version has an extra verse:

Sono ancora in piedi in questo istante di pura follia

Non so piu se desiderare il bene o il male

Anche se il peccato forse piu ma da

Or in English,

I am still standing in this moment of pure madness

I donâ€™t know anymore if I should desire good or evil

Although sin maybe gives me more

9.4. What is 1:19 about?

Only the band knows. Theyâ€™ve decided to keep the meaning of the song amongst themselves. In an interview with Emptyspiral.net Cristina did give away a clue to meaning: â€œWe can only say, itâ€™s the distance between two places. But weâ€™ll never say more than that.â€ <- That hasnâ€™t stopped Matt from Emptyspiral trying at all possibilities to discover the secret!

9.5. My copy of Unleashed Memories has five extra tracks on it. What does that mean?

It means you have a re-release of Unleashed Memories album, which includes the entire HalfLife EP on it as a bonus. In fact the only version of UM that is presently in print in the US is the one with the bonus tracks.

[hozbreaktop]

10. Comalies

10.1. Where does the name come from?

Coma + Lies, a combination of the 2 words. In Cristinaâ€™s own words, â€œ[during the albumâ€™s recording], we had a sort of creative explosion and forgot everything else to concentrate on the album. We were working in a coma, sort of like in a different dimension. First of all we just wanted to use the word coma but there was something missing so we played with the two words coma and lies.â€ Source: interview on www.live4metal.com, 9/02

10.2. How do you pronounce â€˜Comaliesâ€™?

Coma-lyze, or Coma-lies, not comalees! ğŸ™‚

10.3 Why is there sunflower on the cover?

Cristina explains in the interview with www.live4metal.com:

â€œWe just collected different ideas from different artists. We tried everything really from animals to abstract ideas. With Unleashed Memories we think that sun represented perfectly the way we are. With this it is black in the background and then the colour very much in your face, is a strong symbol. You will recognize it immediately if you see it in the shop for example and its not something negative at all. We are really positive people despite the fact that we like aspects of melancholy in our songs but thatâ€™s normal in a human being of course. You have the happiness and the darkness and we like to have the balance between these parts. We feel we are in the middle. We are not too Gothic and not too happy. We like to share a mixture of things. We like the sunflower and if you look there is an eye inside it, which really catches you and represents us perfectly. It represents the way we are now, really simple and really intense.â€

10.4. Iâ€™ve heard that thereâ€™s a special box set available. Is this true?

Yes. It was released in Germany in the fall of â€™02. Itâ€™s supposedly out of print, but still may be found on the Internet if you look carefully. The Comalies box includes a Digipack version of Comalies (with the â€˜Lost Lullabyâ€™ song as a bonus), a poster of Cristina and a Comalies pin badge.

10.5 Whatâ€™s the deal with the 2CD edition of Comalies?

Century Media released a new version of the album in 2004, with a free bonus CD containing nine new recordings, and other goodies. This version is called the â€˜Limited Ozzfest Editionâ€™ in the US and in Europe as â€˜Limited Edition Deluxe Editionâ€™. The two versions have different covers:

The â€˜Ozzfest Editionâ€™ has twelve small â€˜boxesâ€™on the cover containing flower or flame images. The â€˜Limited Edition Deluxe Editionâ€™ excludes the boxes and has a black band at the top and bottom of the cover.

10.6 Whatâ€™s on the bonus CD of the 2CD of Comalies?

The bonus CD contains the following audio tracks:

1. Heavens a Lie (Radiomix and Edit)

2. Swamped (Radiomix and Edit)

3. Heavens a Lie (Studio acoustic version)

4. Swamped (Studio acoustic version)

5. Senzafine (Studio acoustic version)

6. Unspoken (Studio acoustic version)

7. Heavens a Lie (live Radio WAAF acoustic)

8. Senzafine (live Radio WAAF acoustic)

9. Aeon (live Radio WAAF acoustic)

There are also two video files of LACUNA COILs released single â€“ â€˜Heavens a Lieâ€™ and â€˜Swampedâ€™. The â€˜Limited Ozzfest Editionâ€™ has the videos in Quicktime (.MOV) format. The â€˜Limited Edition Deluxe Editionâ€™ has the videos in MPEG format.

Note: There is no menu for the videos. To play them, â€˜exploreâ€™ the CD on a PC or Mac and open them as you would any video file.

Finally the European â€˜Limited Edition Deluxe Editionâ€™ has seven LACUNA COIL desktop wallpaper image files on it that are not on the â€˜Limited Ozzfest Editionâ€™

10.7. Heavens a Lie is an anti-religious song isnâ€™t it?

No, not at all. The song is about a relationship, not religion. Itâ€™s pretty obvious if you read the lyrics ğŸ™‚

10.8. Whatâ€™s wrong with Aeon? It keeps skipping.

Yeah I thought something was wrong with my CD, too! Seriously though, the skipping effect was intentional, they put it on it just for fun and liked the way it sounded, so it stayed.
